====== DESCRIPTION ======

FRESH BLOOD is an international open call exhibition opportunity hosted by PROTO GOMEZ, a storefront contemporary art gallery, located in the Two-Bridges neighborhood of Manhattan, New York City.
http://proto-gomez.gallery

FRESH BLOOD as an art show, seeks to showcase exciting and innovative contemporary art, produced in a variety of media. While there are no restrictions and applications are open to all, selection preference will be given to artists who have not previously shown with PROTO GOMEZ, PROTO Gallery, The Dorado Project, and their affiliates. FRESH BLOOD will be curated by Nick De Pirro and Enrico Gomez, co-founders and owners of PROTO GOMEZ.

In addition to the art show FRESH BLOOD, this open call has been created to provide an organized means for emerging and mid-career artists to bring their work to the attention of the gallery as well as independent curators and arts organizers we collaborate with. Submitted work will also be considered for one or more of the following:
‚Ä¢ Solo exhibitions at PROTO GOMEZ Gallery
‚Ä¢ Online Group Exhibitions Presented on our PROTO GOMEZ Artsy Profile
‚Ä¢ Solo and Group Exhibitions in our affiliated 2500 s.f. gallery, PROTO Gallery, located in the historic former R. Neumann and Co. leather goods factory in Hoboken, NJ.
‚Ä¢ Future Art Fairs
‚Ä¢ Inclusion in our Gallery Inventory and Artsy Listing
‚Ä¢ Exposure to Independent Curators in partnership with PROTO GOMEZ for In-house Projects as well as Affiliated Galleries and Art Spaces
A submission to this open call does not guarantee inclusion in the FRESH BLOOD exhibition or affiliated opportunities, however all entires are seen and considered by Nick De Pirro, Enrico Gomez, and selected independent curators.

Thank you for your interest in our FRESH BLOOD 2019 open call.

===== INSTRUCTIONS =====

Applicants must apply via our Submittable link below:
https://protogallery.submittable.com/submit/137177/fresh-blood

Application Announcement: APRIL 10, 2019
Final Submission Deadline: SEP 2, 2019, 11:59pm
Acceptance Notifications: First Week of OCT 2019
Accepted Artworks Received By: SAT NOV 16, 2019
Gallery Exhibition: DEC 4 - DEC 22 2019
Opening Reception: WED DEC 4 2019 from 6-8PM

ELIGIBILITY:
All artists over the age of 18 years old are eligible. While open to all, selection preference will be given to artists who have not previously shown with PROTO GOMEZ, PROTO Gallery, The Dorado Project, and their affiliates.
Only original works may be submitted. The fee is $30.00 US for up to five (5) images. All entries must be registered/received by Sep 2, 2019 11:59 PM ET All entry fees are non-refundable.

PRESENTATION:
1. Maximum Size: 48‚Äù X 48‚Äù X 12‚Äù D
2. All artwork must be suitably framed to a professional standard. All framed work must use Plexiglas, except hand-delivered work less than 24‚Äù x 30‚Äù. Wall mounted sculpture, canvas and wood panels do not require a frame. No clip frames, saw-tooth hangers or taped edges are permitted. Video work must include all equipment.
3. Work must be wired or have a cleat attachment and be ready for hanging. A label must be affixed to the back of the work that indicates which end is the top and includes the following: Artist Name, Title, Date, Medium, Dimensions, and Price. This information must correspond with the Accepted image as listed on Notification form. No artwork may be substituted.
4. Accepted work may be refused if it does not conform to the entered image. NO SUBSTITUTIONS of accepted works will be allowed.
5. Work cannot be withdrawn, nor sales shipped, before the end of the exhibition.

SHIPPING:
Artists will be responsible for delivery and return shipping of all their artwork. The artist assumes all responsibility for insuring artwork against shipping damage or loss. (A Condition Report will be issued to each artist upon receipt of their artwork to the gallery). Shipped work must arrive at the gallery (or alternate, mutually agreed upon location) by SATURDAY, NOV 16, 2019 in a reusable container. A computer-generated return label for return of work MUST be enclosed. Pre-paid shipping arrangements must be made through UPS or FedEx websites. No U.S. Postal Service or COD returns. No Cash, Check, Stamps, or Credit Card Information Will Be Accepted For Return of Work. NO EXCEPTIONS.

LIABILITY:
PROTO GOMEZ, and their respective representatives and affiliates, is not responsible for any damage, breakage, replacement or cost associated with any damage or breakage that may have occurred during transport or unpacking the work. Every precaution will be taken in handling the work, but PROTO GOMEZ, and their respective representatives and affiliates, assumes no liability for any loss or damage to any artist‚Äôs work while in our care, custody or control, before, during or after the exhibition. Each artist may, if they wish, provide their own insurance.

SALES/COMMISSIONS:
All artwork must be priced for retail sale.
Artwork cannot be withdrawn, nor sales shipped, prior to the end of the exhibit.
PROTO GOMEZ will retain a 50% commission on all exhibition sales. The price represented on the artist entry form will be the final retail price. Any Discounts (of up to 10%) are agreed upon in this agreement, and artist and gallery agrees to split discount equally. (Discounts greater than 10% require prior approval of the artist). An additional Consignment Form will be e-mailed to accepted artists and need to be filled out, signed, scanned by the accepted artists and e-mailed back to gallery prior to the exhibition.

ENTRY AGREEMENT:
With the submission of artwork into the FRESH BLOOD Exhibition, the artist agrees to all of the above terms and conditions set forth in these exhibition guidelines. Your fee payment will serve as your acceptance of the terms and conditions stated in this prospectus.

Monochromic works are works of art in black and white or in varying tones of a single color. By reducing their color palettes artists can to push the viewer to think about the work in a new way, understand a new concept or subject. Site:Brooklyn is looking for monochrome works across all mediums and utilizing all processes.

ABOUT THE JUROR:
Donna Harkavy is a New York-based independent curator. She began her curatorial career at the Walker Art Center in Minneapolis and later worked as Exhibitions Coordinator at ICI in New York. From 1990-1995 Ms. Harkavy was Curator of Contemporary Art at the Worcester Art Museum in Massachusetts, where she founded the contemporary art program. She is currently on the Board of Trustees of the Munson-Williams-Proctor Arts Institute, Foster Pride, Dorsky Gallery Curatorial Projects and the Raoul Hague Foundation.

====== DESCRIPTION ======

treat gallery is excited to participate at PULSE Art Fair in Miami Beach this December 2019 during Art Basel week. treat gallery will also return as an exhibitor to satellite art show for their inaugural New York City premiere in October of 2019. With both exhibitions, we will be raising funds for the New York chapter of the Human Rights Campaign, and the onePULSE foundation in Orlando, FL.

The #1 goal of treat gallery is to help others. Our exhibitions and partnerships raise funds for charities and non-profit organizations. While the parameters of this application may seem unconventional, please refer to the colorful image on our application as a guide to what we're looking for. The end goal is a colorful, clean rainbow-esque grid from floor to ceiling. Early deadline is September 15th.

The content is open, the type of art is open (photography, prints, illustrations, etc) but the art must feature one color in 75% or more of the piece, and it must be a square. No squares? Consider cropping an image for this fundraising event.

IMPORTANT: Please keep in mind that upon acceptance, we will take your image and make it available in an edition of 5, so if you submit a drawing or an original piece, we will be selling a reproduction of this. We recommend photography, printmaking and digital illustration for this project, but we welcome all submissions. Surprise us! Black and White work is welcome, as long as there is a dominant shade in the work.

*by paying an application fee for this opportunity, you will be exempt from paying any application fees throughout 2020. If you've applied or participated in our #treatamericaproject or satellite art show Austin, reach out to us directly for your waiver.


===== INSTRUCTIONS =====

You must apply via this form.
https://form.jotform.com/treatgallery/octobersatellite

All questions: info@treatgallery.org

Voted best Art Fair by the Miami New Times, SATELLITE ART SHOW presents interactive projects by young dealers, artist-run spaces and non-profits. By fostering a range of programming, SATELLITE is able to offer patrons and collectors with a unique experience where art is at the forefront of creative expression, activism, and curiosity. Our exhibitors are encouraged to provide our visitors both an opportunity to collect new works of art as well as to present exhibitions that are engaging, experiential and interactive. SATELLITE is expanding perceptions on art and community and providing an inclusive environment for guests to feel comfortable in exploration and discovery.

about PULSE art fair
In celebration of their 15th anniversary, PULSE Art Fair is dedicating this edition to creating an atmosphere that will have you lingering for hours and leaving with artwork to add to your collection. In the overwhelming environment that is Miami Art Week, we are your calm in the palms. Experience the energy of stimulating art and balance it with cocktails in hammocks and engaging conversations with friends over a meal in our restaurant. PULSE isn‚Äôt just an art fair, anymore.
